ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Definitely recommend for anyone interested in Development.

This is the class where you decide to "specialize" in some sub-area of development by writing your final paper. The class is designed in a way that no one is obliged to do anything, it's all about one's interests and motivation
Economic Development is a seminar style class with class discussions depending on the students themselves. Professor Boozer presents various themes with enthusiasm.
It is a great introduction to development economics which I would recommend since it allosw you to focus on your own interests in the project.
Great course Teach you a lot in development economics
No, its hard to learn much during this class as there is no incentive structure.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course was somewhat hit and miss regarding the relevance of lectures to my areas of study. Some days we covered important theories that have shaped how development is conducted. Other days we focused on mathematical models without an obvious link to development.
Economic Development is a core IDE course. The readings and class topics introduced me to new ideas and concepts in the field.
This deepened my knowledge a lot by allowing me to practice my research skills.
Expand my knowledge in development economics
It didnt really help a lot.
